column4: I prefer KDE over Gnome. If you faster software, use XFCE. If you want even faster and with full control (you need to be advanced user), have a look at Fluxbox.
gedit works under KDE. But the default under KDE is kwrite I think.
You may just get the list of packages you installed, with "dpkg -l" in command line.
You can install a .deb package with "dpkg -i package.deb".
